physical_examinations.relevant_findings: 1-cm erythematous plaque on the left side of the chin and a 1.5-cm lesion on the right forearm. No ulceration.
Fluctuant lesion on the right forearm; incision yielded a small amount of bloody fluid.

2-cm area of faded erythema with a depressed, atrophic plaque on the left side of the chin; 5-cm well-demarcated, depressed, atrophic plaques on both forearms; two 2-mm ulcers on the right labium minus and vaginal fourchette.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The lesion on the chin has faded, while the right forearm lesion remained unchanged.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Occlusion of the left subclavian artery at the origin, thickened vessel wall indicative of acute inflammation.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Diagnosis was made of Takayasu’s arteritis.
